mods.abstract: A Runaway in Jail. WAS committed into the Jail of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 20th July instant, 1855, a Negro-Man, calling himself JOE, aged about 29 or 30 years, 5 feet 6 inches high ; he speaks French and broken English, is black, stout built ; he has lost several of his upper front teeth. Joe says he belongs to Mr. Robert Cade, residing in the Parish of Vermillion, where he ran away a good while ago. The owner is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take him away, otherwise he will be disposed of according to law. CHS. THOMPSON, Jailor. Opelousas, July 28th, 1855.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
